result.execSummary:
Matthew Ryan Herbert was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Matthew Ryan Herbert was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Ryan Herbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by EJL and Defendant this date. eif

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes, DF:  Matthew Ryan Herbert appeared from jail, pro se. Defendant has a felony warrant out of Washington County MN. Atty Andrea states Defendant wishes to waive so will not assist. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Defendant waives extradition freely and knowingly.
